name: One bottle
description: Donna’s Big Lip Red is a 2007 red wine blend consisting of 67% Petite Verdot and 33% Cabernet Franc from Mendocino County. Handcrafted in small open top fermenters and aged one year in French oak barrels. This wine offers up intense aromas of blackberry, ripe plum and sweet toasty oak. The flavors are delicate yet rich with cassis, blackcherry caramel, vanilla and spice. The rich fruit is perfectly framed by the oak and the soft lingering texture on the palate adds to the sensory experience. Donna’s Big Lip Red is a tribute to my late sister Donna Gross who lost her life while taking care of the mentally ill at Napa State Hospital in 2010. She was known for her caring spirit, loving nature and especially her Big Red Lips. Salute, Donna! Harvest Notes: Brix 24.5 pH: 3.54 TA: .62 Alcohol: 13.5 The varietals were fermented separately in half-ton open-top fermenters and punched down twice a day, pressed at dryness after 12 days of fermentation, transferred to barrels of 50% New French Oak and 50% 1-2 year old French Oak, and finally aged for one year. The Petite Verdot brings structure, depth and richness to the blend while the Cabernet Franc brings delicate and bright red fruit aromas. (Shipping will calculate on the payment page. Shipping subject to laws in your state. If it is not lawful to ship wine to your state, we will cancel your order and issue a refund.)
